metadata.title: CVE-2020-7105 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
async.c and dict.c in libhiredis.a in hiredis through 0.14.0 allow a NULLpointer dereference because malloc return values are unchecked.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7105` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libhiredis0.10 - 0.11.0-4+deb8u1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: hiredis package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.11.0-4+deb8u1').
